info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over the Columbia metro area. These storms were nearly stationary.
...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor...
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Harbison State Forest, Sesquicentennial State Park, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, and Fort Jackson.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 47 and 79. Interstate 26 between mile markers 93 and 121. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 24.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
